findings.title: Admin can't withdraw the rewards in full
findings.description: Admin passes the stETH amount for withdrawal in the DegaISPO::adminWithdraw function, and the contract incorrectly decreases degaTreasuryShares by the stETH amount. Impact: Admin can't withdraw all the rewards accrued for the Dega treasury. Part of the rewards will get stuck in the contract without the possibility of withdrawal.

findings.title: Users can't withdraw stETH in an emergency
findings.description: The vulnerability in the **emergencyWithdraw** function arises from the calculation of **currentAmount** . When **user.amount** is less than **totalStakeTokenDeposited** , the division results in **0** because Solidity does not handle fractional numbers in integer  division. This means **currentAmount** will always be **0** in such cases, leading to the require statement after it always reverting the transaction, thereby preventing any withdrawals.

findings.title: Possible underflow
findings.description: This line can lead to underflow because user.shares may be greater than totalSharesDeposited.

findings.title: Admin has an economic incentive to lock user funds forever
findings.description: The admin can change the owner for PAUSE_ROLE, pause the contract, and switch isEmergencyWithdrawEnabled = false so that users can't withdraw funds. Locked funds still generate rewards, and the admin can withdraw rewards by preventing users from withdrawing deposits.

findings.title: Users can steal funds with negative stETH rebase
findings.description: DegaISPO::withdraw doesn't handle the stETH negative rebase scenario, allowing users to steal funds.

findings.title: Resetting earned rewards upon deposit and partial withdrawal
findings.description: During deposit, all rewards that have already been earned by the user are reset to zero due to incorrect debt recalculation. This also occurs during partial withdrawal of funds, causing users to lose all earned rewards for the period.

findings.title: The efficiency of receiving rewards decreases for early investors
findings.description: Early investors who put their stETH into the protocol have lower returns over time than latecomers due to the profitability of shares transferred to Dega Treasury being no longer considered.

findings.title: Possible multiplying of totalStakeTokenDeposited
findings.description: The totalStakeTokenDeposited variable can be wound up several times compared to the actual value while the divisor's (poolETHSize) value remains unchanged, leading to overflow of deposit() and withdraw() functions.

findings.title: Gas optimization: Custom errors
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Redundant whenNotPaused modifier
findings.description: The whenNotPaused modifier is redundant for DegaISPO::deposit and DegaISPO::withdraw functions.

findings.title: The tolerance check is redundant
findings.description: The tolerance check is redundant because the contract uses the **StETH::transferSharesFrom** function to transfer StETH, which doesn't result in [1-2 wei corner case]

findings.title: Invalid code style
findings.description: The audit report recommends replacing/removing certain parts of the code to maintain a valid code style.

findings.title: Gas optimizations: memory instead of storage
findings.description: Lines of code could be optimized, saving variables to memory, or even returning them at once.

findings.title: Permit mechanic
findings.description: Lido has a permit mechanic on stETH that allows you to approve and transfer tokens in one transaction using the correct signature, which is very convenient.

findings.title: Insufficient zero checks
findings.description: The constructor and withdraw function do not have sufficient zero checks.

findings.title: Gas optimization: Redundant expressions/variables
findings.description: The finding highlights redundant expressions and variables in the code that can be optimized to reduce gas usage.

findings.title: Misuse of input amounts instead of final ones
findings.description: The provided lines with conditions and emitted events use input or virtual amounts for these expressions.

findings.title: Gas optimization: Cache storage variables
findings.description: There are several places where storage variables can be cached to reduce gas usage.

findings.title: View function not view in the interface
findings.description: The function stETH::sharesOf is view in contract stETH but it is not view in interface ILido, causing external calls to use CALL opcode instead of STATICCALL.

findings.title: Redundant variables
findings.description: Unused or redundant variables/expressions found in the contract.

findings.title: Invalid user.shares calculation
findings.description: **user.shares** can have an invalid value after a series of deposit and withdraw operations.

findings.title: Unnecessary check
findings.description: Removing unnecessary tolerance checks to prevent potential issues.

findings.title: Incorrect variable name
findings.description: The variable totalStakeT displays the number of tokens deposited into the contract but may not match the actual balance due to a negative rebase or an error of 1-2 wei.
